regular.expressions.pkg1

Class ValidateInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • regular.expressions.pkg1.ValidateInput

  • public class ValidateInput
extends java.lang.Object
    The ValidateInput class contains a series of static methods that compare Strings to regular expressions in the String.matches() method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ValidateInput() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean validateDOB(java.lang.String dob)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the dob (date of birth) parameter is a valid date including number of specific days in a month and with February 29th leap year checking.
      static boolean validateEmail(java.lang.String email)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the email parameter is in a valid email address format.
      static boolean validateFirstName(java.lang.String firstName)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the firstName parameter begins with an uppercase letter and then continues with only zero (0) or more uppercase and/or lowercase letters.
      static boolean validateLastName(java.lang.String lastName)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the lastName parameter begins with either an uppercase or lowercase letter, and then continues with only zero (0) of more uppercase and/or lowercase letters and a possible hyphen (-) or apostrophe (').
      static boolean validatePassword(java.lang.String password)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the password parameter contains at least eight (8) characters of any type.
      static boolean validatePasswordAgain(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String passwordAgain)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the password parameter matches the passwordAgain parameter.
      static boolean validatePhone(java.lang.String phone)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the phone parameter is in a valid format with the area code separated from the rest of the number by either parentheses or a dash.
      static boolean validateSocSecNumber(java.lang.String socSecNumber)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the socSecNumber parameter is in the format of a valid social security number (999-99-9999).
      static boolean validateUserID(java.lang.String userID)
      Returns a boolean value indicating if the userID parameter contains at least eight (8) characters which only include uppercase and/or lowercase letters.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static boolean validateFirstName(java.lang.String firstName)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if the firstName parameter begins with an uppercase letter and then continues with only zero (0) or more uppercase and/or lowercase letters.
        Parameters:
        firstName - the first name of a user
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the first name is valid.

      • validateLastName

        public static boolean validateLastName(java.lang.String lastName)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if the lastName parameter begins with either an uppercase or lowercase letter, and then continues with only zero (0) of more uppercase and/or lowercase letters and a possible hyphen (-) or apostrophe (').
        Parameters:
        lastName - the last name of a user
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the last name is valid.

        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the user ID is valid.

      • validatePasswordAgain

                                            java.lang.String passwordAgain)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if the password parameter matches the passwordAgain parameter.
        Parameters:
        password - the password of a user
        passwordAgain - the password to compare for equality to the password
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the password is valid.

      • validatePhone

        public static boolean validatePhone(java.lang.String phone)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if the phone parameter is in a valid format with the area code separated from the rest of the number by either parentheses or a dash.
        Parameters:
        phone - the phone number of a user
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the phone number is valid.

      • validateSocSecNumber

        public static boolean validateSocSecNumber(java.lang.String socSecNumber)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if the socSecNumber parameter is in the format of a valid social security number (999-99-9999).
        Parameters:
        socSecNumber - the social security number of a user
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the social security number is valid.

        Returns a boolean value indicating if the email parameter is in a valid email address format.
        Parameters:
        email - the e-mail address of a user
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if user the email address is valid.

      • validateDOB

        public static boolean validateDOB(java.lang.String dob)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if the dob (date of birth) parameter is a valid date including number of specific days in a month and with February 29th leap year checking. This format String also can check for valid time of day entry.
        Parameters:
        dob - the date of birth of a user
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the date of birth is valid
